english: Come on.
Shame on you.
Too bad.
You do not deserve any of this, Gundogdu.
I told your father.

text: Esirleri vermezsen gök kubbeyi başına yıkarım.
english: If you do not give the prisoners, I will destroy the sky.
Now, let him think.
Your customs?
Or will he choose his son?

text: Sana yüzünü kara çıkarmadan döveceğim dedim.
english: I said I would beat you before I could make you look bad.

text: Bugün ben susacağım, siz konuşacaksınız toyda.
english: I will keep quiet and you will speak at the meeting.
...and Ertugrul was talking about his victory...
...and rub it on your face.
The robbers want alive.
Take it.

text: Belli ki Kara Toygar'ın içeride bir adamı var. Biz yokken obayı basacak cesareti vermiş ona. Beyimin şüphelendiği biri mi var?
english: It is obvious that Kara Toygar has a man inside. He dared to raid the tribe when we were not there. Is there anyone suspicious of my Bey?
Afsin.
The merchant's man?
I'll finish what I left tomorrow.
I will do this without a sound.

text: İçinden nazlı bir bebek gibi büyüdün tıkamını.
english: You grew up like a baby with a baby inside you.

text: Ama asla görevlerinin önüne geçmesine izin verme.
english: But never let them get ahead of their duties.
...to prevent the Turks from coming to our borders.

text: Yeni yurdumuz atalarımızın destanlarında anlattıkları efsanevi topraklara benziyor.
english: Our new homeland resembles the legendary lands that our ancestors described in their manuscripts.

text: Yurdu aldık diye her şey güllük gülistanlık değil elbet. Yeni menzilimiz toprağa bereketli......ama düşmanı da bir o kadar yaman bir yer.
english: We took the homeland, so it is not all about the glory. Our new position is fertile but the enemy is also a very bad place.
There is a cross at the bottom of our nose.

text: Çocuklarımız ve sürülerimiz büyürken......etrafımızdaki fitne ateşi de büyüyecek.
english: While our children and our tribes grow, the fire of slander will grow around us.
If so...

text: Neden bize atadan dededen kalma masallar anlatıp......aklımızı bulandırırsın Ertuğrul Bey?
english: Why do you tell us stories from our ancestors and confuse us, Ertugrul Bey?
Yes, Alpargu is right.
You are wrong, Mr. Pargu.
Do you think our ancestors' legends are fairy tales?

text: Onlar bebeği uyutmak için değil adamı uyandırmak içindir.
english: They are not for the baby but to wake the man up.

text: Biz onlardan bereketli toprakları da öğrendik. Etrafını saran demir dağları eritmeyi de.
english: We learned about the fertile lands from them......and the iron mountains surrounding them.

text: Babana son bir fırsat vereceğim Gündoğdu.
english: I will give your father one last chance, Gundogdu.
Alp's Hamza.
...to your father.
All by himself.
...will offer to bring him to me.
...if you don't accept my offer.

text: Önce seni, sonra bütün kıyıları kılıçtan geçireceğim.
english: First I will kill you, then I will kill all the Kays.
To our new home...
Let the Alps play sword and shield.
Let's make them live the way we see them.
I brought you greetings from the Knights of the Temple, Ertugrul. I brought you greetings from the Knights of the Temple, Ertugrul.
Thank you.
You can't be the daughter of the tribe from the daughter of the wild.
Don't think about it.
And...

text: Seni tez vakitte Gökçe kızımızla baş göz etmek isteriz.
english: We want to see you with our daughter Gokce as soon as possible.
Come on.

text: Ne istermiş bu Kara Toygar denilen yılan?
english: What does this snake called Kara Toygar want?
The guests I brought for Ertugrul Bey, my Bey.
Kara Toygar wants them.
If you don't give it tomorrow...
Come on.
They will kill Gundogdu Bey.

text: Şimdi sana tek bir soru soracağım.
english: I will ask you one question.

text: Ve karşılığında senden tek bir cevap istiyorum.
english: And I want only one answer from you.
Who are you?
...from the great Seljuk dynasty...
Muzafferuddin Davut.
Muhyiddin, son of Mesut Shah.
Sultan Ezzettin...
I am the grandson of the sword lion. I am the prince of Seljuk.
subscribe
...that Sire Togar wanted.
He does everything for them.
As long as we know how to ask.
If not, as you say.
Then we all die, father.
But at least...

text: Elimizde kılıcımız, onurumuzla ölürüz. Süleyman Şah'ı iyi tanırım. O kendi canını ortaya koyar.
english: We have our swords and we will kill with our honor. I know Suleyman Shah very well. He will show his true colors.

text: Kara Toygar ikisini de ortadan kaldıracak.
english: Farah Toygar will remove them both.
There is only Ertugrul left.
And...
You went too far, my Bey. Too far.

text: Bu işin sonu hiç iyi değil. Ulan it! Madem bu kadar korkuyordun......niye benimle birlik oldun?
english: This is not the end of the story. You idiot! If you were so scared, why did you join me?

text: Obanın düze çıkması için beyim. Bu işin buraya varacağını... Neye varacak ha? Neye varacak?
english: I think this job will end here... What will it end? What will it end?

text: Büyüğün bir mesele konuşulmakta Selcan Hatun. Çekil önümden. Beyimizin emri...
english: A big matter is being discussed, Selcan Hatun. Get out of my way. Our Bey's order.
I told you to get out of my sight!
We will set up a trap at Kartal Hill.

text: Her ne olursa olsun şehzadeleri Kara Toygar almamalı.
english: Whatever happens, we shouldn't take the Shahzadas from Kara Toygar.

text: Ya Sultan Alaaddin'i şehzadelere götürmeyi başarırsa?
english: If Sultan Aladdin manages to take the princes...
Alaaddin's
He will be the most eye-catching commander.
The Templars keep Konya in a safe place.

text: Devletin içinde cirit atarlar. Bunun vebali büyük olur Sarı.
english: They put a lock on the government. This will cause a lot of trouble.
We didn't build this state easily.
If necessary
We won't hesitate to kill the Shahzadas.
I would have given you a job if I were not here.
Suleyman Shah.
...with Ertugrul...

text: Kara Toygar'ı Kartal Tepesi'nde tuzağa düşürecek.
english: ...will set Karatoygar in a trap on Kartal Hill.

text: ...vellerine izin mi vereceğiz beyim? Kara Toygar'ın avı daha bereketli olsun diye izin vereceğiz Alpargu. Elim kılıcıma gitmeden, üstüme kan bulaşmadan......obayı bütün pisliklerden temizledim.
english: Will we let them go, my Bey? We will let them go so that Kara Toygar's hunt is more fruitful, Alpargu. I cleaned the tribe of all filth before I lost my hand and blood.
Come on.

text: Sen ne işler çeviriyorsun Süleyman Şah?
english: What are you doing, Suleyman Shah?
Where are they?
You will take what you want when you leave my son.
Are you silent?

text: Oğlumla benim canım mı daha kıymetli yoksa şehzadelerin mi?
english: Is my son and my life more precious......or the Shahzadas?
You will set me free, Kara Toygar.
Are you threatening me?
...if you hurt your mind.
Ertugrul will take them out of the Serçuklu lands.

text: Bir daha onların izini asla bulamayacaksın.
english: You will never find their traces again.
Listen.
...and the Templars you serve.
If I let you go...
I'll take you to them.
Where are they?
I left them with Ertugrul so they wouldn't run away.

text: Ya da başımıza bir iş gelirse...
english: ...or if something happens to us...
Sultan Aladdin will know everything.

text: Esade yazdığı bir mektupta Sultan Alaaddin her şeyi anlattı.
english: The Shah told everything about Sultan Aladdin in a letter he wrote.
...how the Templars survived.

text: Kendisini sultan yapmak için nasıl işkenceler edildiğini...
english: ...how he was tortured to make him the Sultan.
Despite these tortures...
...that the state never sold.
You cooperated with the Templars.
He released you.
I'm sorry.
Go.
I told you to go.
Where is Akcakoca?

text: İçeride biri mi var yoksa? Ne oluyor burada?
english: Is there anyone inside? What's going on here?

text: Neden sizdeki? Çekil Akçakoca. Çekil de içeride kim var görelim. Size ne bunlar? Çekil Akçakoca!
english: Why are you here? Move aside, Akcakoca. Move aside so we can see who is inside. What is this to you? Move aside, Akcakoca!
What you say is true.

text: Ne diyorsunuz siz ha? Evlatlarımız ölmüş Hayme Ana onlar yüzünden.
english: What are you talking about? Our children are dead, mother Hayme. Because of them.
They smashed the caravan! You can't tell us!

text: Töreği ve beyi çiğnersin sen. Yazıklar olsun size. Yeter artık Ayman'a.
english: You are insulting our Bey and our tribe. Shame on you! Enough, Mother Hayme.

text: Töre diyorsun? Daha kaç canımız ölecek? Evlatlarımızın cenazeleri nerede? Süleyman Şah nerede?
english: You say so. How many more lives will we lose? Where are our children's graves? Where is Suleyman Shah?

text: Senin değil benim oğlum öldü Hayme Ana.
english: My son died, not yours, mother Hayme.
Everyone in this tribe
My son.
My heart.

text: Oba dediğin birlik ve beraberliğin olduğu zaman ayakta kalır.
english: When there is unity and solidarity, the tribe stands.

text: Birlik bozulmuşsa düşmanın karşısında yenilmeye, yok olmaya mahkulsünüzdür.
english: If the unity is broken, you are doomed to be defeated and destroyed by the enemy.

text: Süleyman Şah Bey'imiz kendi canını sizin canınızın önüne koymuş mudur?
english: Did Suleyman Shah put his own life in front of yours?

text: Evlatlarınız sakınmış. Obanın iyiliğinden öte yol seçmiş midir? Ne yaparsa yapsın.
english: He has spoiled your children. He chose the wrong path for the good of the tribe. No matter what he does
For the good and safety of the tribe.

text: Onun yokluğunda obanın birliğini bozmak, taşkınlık yapmak size yaraşır mı?
english: Is it appropriate for you to ruin the unity of the tribe......and to be a rebel in his absence?

text: ...föreyi ezmeye kalkarsanız......elbet bir gün ezilirsiniz. Bundan sonra...
english: If you try to crush the custom......you will be crushed one day. After that...

text: Onlara taş atan bana taş atmış olur. Onları karşısına alan beni karşısına almış olur. Bu böyle bilinen.
english: Whoever throws stones at them, throws stones at me. Whoever stands against them, stands against me. This is how it is.
Come on.
He's playing a game with you.
How did they find out about our relationship, Titos?
Ertugrul.
Understanding this was a matter of time.
Damn it.
I have to kill them all.

text: Şehzadenin sultana yazdığı mektup ne olacak?
english: What will be the letter that the Shahzada wrote to the Sultan?
My friends in the palace...

text: O mektupların sultanın eline geçmesine engel olur.
english: It prevents those letters from going to the Sultan's hands.
I hope.
Come on.
God!
Who is this?
They will.
God protect her.

text: Sana bir şey olacak diye çok korktum.
english: I was so scared that something would happen to you.

text: Sana bir şey olsaydı Süleyman Şah'a ne derdim ben?
english: If something had happened to you, what would I say to Suleyman Shah?
Stay here until they come back.
While we were waiting for our loved ones to return...
We will be friends.
With prayer.
With faith and patience.
What a great man this Kayi is.
It is all because of him.
What is this?
in my heart.
God knows.

text: Kendimi hiç bu kadar çaresiz hissetmemiştim.
english: I never felt so helpless.
My son.

text: Şu kısacık ömrüme ne badireler sığdı.
english: What bad lucks have I had in my life?
Those who wanted to kill my father and brother.

text: Şehzade oldukları için onları kullanmak isteyen devletler.
english: The states that want to use them because they are the Shahzadas.
The nights we spent in the dungeon.
Every day of God.
I lived with the fear of losing my loved ones.
...woke Ertugrul Bey up to this nightmare.
...into a beautiful dream.
Hayme.

text: Ben hayatım boyunca yaşamadığım huzuru obanızda buldum.
english: I found peace in your tribe that I have never experienced in my life.
What did you say?
Now it is my turn, Zuleyman.
I sent it to the police station, sir.

text: Sen ne yaptın Baybora? Kervan baskını duymayan kalmadı beyim. Obanın ileri gelenleri seni görmek ister.
english: What did you do, Baybora? There is no one left who didn't hear the caravan raid, my Bey. The people of the tribe want to see you.
Then, do not make them wait.

text: Bu uğursuz kızı ne diye alırsın yanına? Ne geldiyse başımıza bunlar yüzünden gelmedi mi?
english: Why do you take this wretched girl with you? Didn't it happen because of them?

text: Ne yüzle durur bizim ocağımızda? Değil otağımızda, obamızda ne işi var bunların?
english: Why are they in our tent? Not in our tent, but in our tribe!
You're asking for it so boldly.
I said immediately!
Everyone in the lodge knows.

text: Beyinizin otağına böyle girmek de neyin nesi?
english: It is not right to enter your Bey's tent like this.
They wanted to meet with their Beys, Hayme.
I did not break their wishes.
Don't reveal yourself. Yes, sir.
Send the princes Ertugrul!
Send my father.
Kill him!
Cennet!
Alper!

text: Ya Süleyman Şah'ımız geri dönmezse ne yapacağız beyim?
english: What if Suleyman Shah doesn't return? What will we do, sir?

text: Beyim bu Kara Toygar hırsını alamaz da üstümüze gelirse ne edeceğiz?
english: My Bey, this Kara Toygar can not take his greed, what will you do if it comes on us?

text: Bitmek tükenmek bilmeyen dertleri varmış obanın.
english: They have endless troubles, my tribe.
We didn't know.
The old men who are in power...
They are trying to make the parliament happy.
Go, go, go!
To know your lioness...

text: Bey'inizin kendisini feda etmesini bekler misiniz?
english: You expected your Bey to sacrifice himself.
We didn't know.
Until now.

text: Sayısız cenkten kan ter içinde döner Süleyman Şah'ımız.
english: Suleyman Shah, who returned from countless wars in a bloody state,
If he sees this,
I'm sure he would be proud.
Kill them all!
Why are you not attacking? Why?
I told you to get out! Get them all out!
Ali!
I will ask you for your revenge!
Get him!
Don't be silly, Karatoyuk.

text: Kimse sana yardıma gelmeyecek. Yalnız konuşmak istiyorum Arturo Bey.
english: No one will help you. I want to talk to you alone, Mr. Arturo.
If you'll excuse me.
I was a commander in the Seljuk army.

text: Hali Selçuk için hem içeride hem dışarıda...
english: I will be both inside and outside for Ali Seljuk.
Let's get the sword.
I'm bleeding.

text: Sonra da kader beni şehzademin yanına savurdu.
english: Then fate brought me to my Shahzada.
My only wish from now on...

text: Tek görevim şehzadem ve ailesini korumak.
english: My only duty is to protect my Shahzada and his family.

text: Kara Toygar'ın yanındaki tanıdığım askerlerle temas kurmam da bundandır. Durum bu, Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I contact the soldiers I know in Kara Toygar. That's the situation, Ertugrul Bey.

text: Benim de istediğim budur Afşin Bey.
english: This is what I want, Afsin Bey.

text: Hem obamı, hem ailemi, hem Halime'yi...
english: My tribe, my family, Halime...
...and to protect Halime's family.
Since our goal is one...

text: O zaman sıra dağlar gibi duralım şu Kara Toygar denen itin karşısında.
english: Then let's stand like a mountain in front of that dog called Kara Toygar.

text: Siz yiğit bir adamsınız Ertuğrul Bey.
english: You are a brave man, Ertugrul Bey.

text: Sizin yanınıza candaş olmak şereftir, onurdur benim için.
english: It is an honor to be your friend.
Tell me, Haldabsi Bey.
The soldiers you are in contact with...
How effective?

text: Şöyle anlatayım Ertuğrul Bey. Kara Toygar aman dilediğinde......yanına bir tane asker bile gelemeyecek kadar etkilirler.
english: Let me put it this way, Ertugrul Bey. When Kara Toygar says, Amen, they will be so impressed that not even a soldier can come to them.
Then, who is going to fall for us...
...to wish her well.

text: O halde bugün Kartal Tepesi'ndeki can pazarında bize kılıç...
english: So, you are going to give us the sword...

text: Sana kalkan olmak düştü Afşin Bey.
english: You are the one who is in trouble, Afsin Bey.
We will attack...

text: Sen de Kara Toygar'ın yanındaki Selçuklu askerlerini olması gereken safta tutacaksın.
english: You will keep in line with the Seljuk soldiers who are with Kara Toygar.

text: Eyvallah Ertuğrul Bey, mutlaka arz olacağız.
english: Thank you, Ertugrul Bey. We will be happy to be with you.

text: Bugün mazlumların yanında, zalimin karşısında saf tutacağız.
english: Today, we will keep the innocent away from the oppressor.
The owner of the oppressed is the witness.
May God be with you and be with you.
What are you doing?
Come on!
I'll burn you too, Kara Toygar.

text: Şehzadelerle birlikte siz de gebereceksiniz! Soyunuzu kurutacağım!
english: You will die with the princes. I will destroy your honor!

text: Geçti artık o günler Hayme Ana.
english: Those days are over mother Hayme.

text: Önümüzdeki yerden nasıl geçeceğiz onu düşünmenin vakti. Alpargu!
english: It's time to think about how we will get through this. Alpargu!
Know your place.

text: Elbette obamızın selameti için konuşacaklarımız var.
english: Of course, we have things to talk about for the safety of our tribe.

text: Ama burası aynı zamanda Süleyman Şah'ımızın mahremidir.
english: But this is also the mahram of our Suleyman Shah.

text: Hayme Anamız'a rahatsızlık vermek uygun düşmez.
english: It is not appropriate to give our mother Hayme a nuisance.
He has enough pain.
We couldn't think of it.
Let's continue in my tent.
Take the Bey's ID to my tent.
I'm sorry.
Thank you, brother.
The ones in the caravan.

text: Alplerin ölmesi hiç birisi senin suçun değildi.
english: It was not your fault that the Alps died.
Did you know that before?

text: Şehzade olduğunu daha evvelden bilir miydin?
english: Did you know he was a prince?
No, I just learned.

text: Ama belli ki saklamak için iyi bir nedenleri varmış.
english: But it is obvious that they have a good reason to hide it.

text: Bizi oyuna getirdiği gibi seni de oyuna getirdi. Lakin sen hala onları savunmaktasın.
english: He brought us to the game and brought you to the game. But you are still defending them.
You are the chiefs of the tribe! Who are you?
The tyranny will not be destroyed, Kara Toygar.
He is full of the memory of his oppression.
Old age.

text: Bu Selçuklu kumandanını derdest eden Türkmen aşireti.
english: The Turkmen tribe who is trying to get the Seljuk commander.
I think when Sultan Aladdin hears this...

text: Kimin gerçekten eşkıya alıyor üfünecek? Nefesini boşuna tüketme Kara Toygar.
english: Who will really be the one to be killed? Don't waste your breath, Kara Toygar.
First the trial will be held.
The decision will be made according to the treaty.
Did he speak to the Torah?
The Bey will be silent, too.
Come on.

text: Nasılsın beyim? Biraz dinlen istersen ha?
english: Are you okay, sir? Would you like to rest a little?
I'm fine, Deli Demir.
Are we going back to the tribe?
Alright.
First, this disgrace.

text: Karavanımızdan gasp ettiğim mallarımızı almaya gideceğiz.
english: We will go to get the goods that we seized from our caravan.
I'm sorry.
You know I love you, Feda.

text: Lakin bu yargının sonu kötüye varmasın.
english: But this trial shouldn't end badly.
Don't worry, Saru.
What is it?
He knew that Kurdoglu was waiting for an opportunity.

text: Yoksa bu kadar tez kurulur muydu makama?
english: Otherwise, would the court be established so quickly?
He's shameless.
and collected his Beydom's signs.

text: Biz de elimiz kolumuz bağlı oturuyoruz.
english: We are sitting here with our arms tied.
Enough, Aykiz.

text: Yeter! Deli dişlerini bilip bilmeden kendi kendine hallenirsin.
english: Enough. You take care of your own business without knowing your own business.

text: Müsaade var mıdır Hayme Hanım? Gel kızım gel.
english: May I come in, Ms Hayme? Come in, dear.
What's up?
You are all waiting for your pain.

text: Karnınızı doyurmak aklınıza gelmez. İki lokma bu ağzınızdan geçsin istedim.
english: You do not want to eat your stomach. I wanted you to eat two bites.
Thank you, dear.

text: Koy elindekini sofraya, geç otur şöyle sen de.
english: Put the one you have on the table. Sit down.
...our hearts and our mouths are waiting for you.
As long as Suleyman Shah is in power...
They will come back after they are healed.

text: Ama ablam Gündoğdu eniştem için çok endişeleniyor.
english: But my sister is worried about Gundogdu.
You are waiting for your fathers.

text: Ben de Ertuğrul Bey'im için dua eder dururum.
english: I keep praying for Ertugrul.
I know your sister has a problem.
But do not worry.
We will leave the tribe soon.

text: İnşallah hepsi sağ salim dönecekler. Bize de dua etmek düşer.
english: I hope they will all be fine. We would like to pray.
You useless dogs, scoundrels! You are all dead!
I will kill you all.
I'll ask you all the answers.
I will destroy you all!
Not our tribe.

text: Kayılar ismini hatırlayan tek bir kişi kalmayacak bu dünyada.
english: There will be no one left in this world who remembers the name Kayi.
I will kill you all!
Now, he is on the way.
before he reached his tribe.
We are catching that dog called Gundogdu.

text: Sonra da Kartal Tepesi'ne getiriyorsun onu.
english: Then you bring him to Kartal Hill.
Kartal Hill? Kartal Hill.

text: Meğer bizi tuzağa düşürecekmiş o kayının keçi çobanlığı.
english: So, the goat shepherd of the Kayi will trap us.
Did you hear that, Zarul?
They will finish the blacksmiths.

text: Dilerseniz önceden varıp tedbirimizi alalım. Evet Sarı Mür.
english: If you wish, we can go there and take our precautions. Yes, Sari Bey.
The ones you trust the most.
...and change the place into the rocks of Kartal Hill.
When I got the signal...

text: Orasını kayılar için bir cehenneme dönüştürmelerini istiyor.
english: He wants to turn that place into hell for the Kayis.
Don't worry.
We checked the room where the goods were placed.
Everything is okay sir.
Are you okay, father?
Good.
You're tired today.

text: Gece burada kalır istirahat edersiniz diye size oda hazırlattım. Dilerseniz buyurun geçelim. Sağol kumandan.
english: I made you a room so you can stay here and rest at night. Please come in. Thank you, sir.
You stay here.
I will go with Gundogdu.
Listen.

text: Seninle konuşmamız gereken bazı meseleler var.
english: There are some things we need to talk about.

text: Başımız açtığı işler yetmezmiş gibi......bir de utanmadan gidip Hayme anaya sığınır.
english: He goes to mother Hayme without any shame as if his work is not enough.
The wolf with the goat's beak.
But I'm Selcan.

text: Bu yaptıklarını sana bir bir ödeteceğim Halime.
english: I will pay you for what you did, Halime.
Sister.

text: Gökçe neredesin sen? Yine hangi kuytuya saklandın? Abla. Elin soysuz kızı gidip Hayme Ana'ya sığınır......benim kardeşim kuytuda köşede bir başına... Abla!
english: Where are you, Gokce? Which tent did you hide in? Sister. You're hiding in the tent with your daughter and my brother is in the corner... Sister!
You'll be wrong.
I'm not hiding anywhere.
...from the tent, from their side.
Look at my brother.
I was taken to their side with the excuse of taking food.
I said what I was going to say and I heard what I was going to hear.

text: Ne duydun? Kurdoğlu beylik alametlerini almış. Çadırına götürmüş.
english: What did you hear? Kurdoglu took the Bey's signatures and took them to his tent.

text: Belli ki Süleyman'ın dönüşünden umut kesilmiş.
english: It seems that the hope for Suleyman's return has been cut off.

text: Beyli kalametlerini çadırına mı götürmüş? Evet.
english: Did the Bey take his signs to his tent? Yes.
What is your intention?
Wait here. Sister!
Gundogdu.
...I saw your look at Ertugrul.
You are his brother.
...he doesn't look at his brother's wife with a blind eye.

text: Ama seni kurtarmak için canına tehlikeye attı.
english: But he risked his life to save you.
What are you saying?
He put his life in danger, right?

text: Canını bizim için mi tehlikeye attı?
english: Did he risk his life for us?

text: Yoksa o çok kıymetli misafirleri için mi orasını bilmem. Ama bildiğim bir şey var.
english: Otherwise, I wouldn't know about that place for those precious guests. But there is something I know.

text: Biz can pazarına düştüysek bunun sorumlusu da Ertuğrul'dur.
english: If we are in trouble, Ertugrul is responsible for it.

text: Senin kervandaki baskından sonra gözlerini kim bürümüş?
english: Who opened his eyes after the raid on your caravan?
You are a victim of the law.

text: ...yarın yerinde midir Kurdoğlu? Gündoğdu'yu kurtarmak yerine Süleyman Şah'ın tahtına oturmak......menun etti mi seni?
english: Is Kurdoglu in your place? Did he make you happy to sit on Suleyman Shah's throne......instead of saving Gundogdu?
You fell into the trouble of your husband.
I won't say you're bored.

text: Ama yerini bil Selcan Hatun. Ben yerimi bilirim. Ondandır hesap sormam.
english: But you know your place, Selcan Hatun. I know my place. That is why I do not ask for an account.

text: ...Gündoğdu'yu kurtarmak için neden bir şey yapmazsın? Sen bu havada olanları görür müsün?
english: Why don't you do something to save Gundogdu? Do you see what is happening?
Do you hear me?

text: Başımıza türlü işler geldi. Eğer ben olaylara el koymasam oba bölünecekti. Başımıza türlü işler kimin yüzünden geldi ha? Ortalığı sen karıştırmadın mı? Süleyman Şah'ın herkesten gizlediğini sana taşıdım. Suç işledim. Ama ve lakin sen ne yaptın? Hiç! Ya ne yapacağımı sanıyordun?
english: We have a lot of things to do. If I didn't take care of the events, the tribe would be divided. Who did you do all these things for? You didn't interfere with the situation. I brought you what Suleyman Shah hid from everyone. I committed a crime. But what did you do? You never... What did you think I would do?
Did you call me a traitor?

text: Obamın gizli niyetini düşmana mı uçuracağım sandın?
english: Did you think I would let my tribe's secret intention to the enemy?
What will happen to them?

text: O Kara Toygar denen it, Gündoğdu'ma kıyarsa...
english: If that dog named Kara Toygar beats my Gundogdu...
We will pray for their salvation.
This is all we have.
I'm sorry.

text: Tılkini yangın yerine dönmeden önce Selçuklu topraklarından bir an önce çıkmalıyız. Kendim için değil.
english: Before we return to the camp, we must leave the Seljuk lands. Not for myself.
Good news from everything.
For my son who is sleeping.
I understand, my Shahzada.

text: Herkesin selameti için en doğru olan bu galiba. Yalnız gitmemiz için bize at ve pusat vermen gerekebilir.
english: I guess this is the best thing for everyone's safety. But you may need to give us a horse and a gun to go there.

text: Benim aklıma başka bir fikir gelmekte.
english: I have another idea.

text: Cenazelerden sonra babamdan müsaade isteyip Halep'e yola koyulacağım.
english: After the funeral, I will ask permission from my father and set off for Aleppo.

text: Sizi sağ salim oraya kadar götürebilirim alplerimle.
english: I can take you there safely with my Alps.

text: Ondan sonrası... Sağ olasın Ertuğrul Bey.
english: Then... Thank you, Ertugrul Bey.
Thank you.

text: Sana ve ailene her zaman minnettar olacağım.
english: I will always be grateful to you and your family.
Tomorrow.
Say maşallah and talk.
...we will set off as soon as possible.
I'm sorry.
We've overcame this situation too.

text: İçimi kemiren bir kurt var Deli Demir.
english: I have a wolf inside me, Deli Demir.
How did he know we were here?

text: Senin için kemiren kurdun anasını benim için mi kemirmekten?
english: The wolf that roams for you roams for me.
I will ask you something, father.
Yes, Master Demir.

text: Bu itlerin Halimelerin çadırına baskın düzenlediği gece...
english: ...when the Alps raided the tents of the Alps.
...and keep them away from the tents.
You were here.
I don't want to take anyone's right, Kurdoglu.
But this is the matter of the tribe.
I swear.
What is it, sir?
They could not.
Damn it!
Don't forget.
When the game is over...
I'm sorry.
And they...
...they will be in the same box.
Who is Galip?
Only the one who lifts them from the table knows.
I see.
Before you enter the house...
Do not be angry with me.

text: Titus'a haber uçur hemen! Kara Toygar'ı...
english: If you get angry, you'll get a news.
...and not let anyone harm him. Titus...

text: Kayıların Halep'e gelmelerini engelleyebilir mi hala?
english: Can I still prevent the Kayis from coming to Aleppo?
I don't know if I can do it.
I cannot see my wound.

text: Azap veriyor ruhuma. Şöyle hazırlıkları yapsınlar hemen Marcos.
english: It's torturing my soul. Tell them to prepare, Markos.

text: Benimle birlikte Halep'e geliyorsun. Nasır'la halletmemiz gereken işlerimiz var.
english: You are coming to Aleppo with me. We have things to do with Nasir.

text: Titus'a başka bir emriniz var mı efendimiz?
english: Do you have any other orders, sir?

text: Kara Toygar'ı Kayıların başına gazap ateşi kılsın. Bu işi ister kendi başına halletsin...
english: Karatoygar should be executed. He should do it himself...
...or Kurdoglu.
I will ask him for his account.
They are the ones who are the ones who are the ones.
Where is Suleyman Shah?

text: Kervanımıza baskın olmuş derler. Cenazeler nerededir beyim? Evet haklı. Bey nerede? Cenazeler nerede?
english: They say our caravan was raided. Where are the bodies, sir? Yes, you're right. Where are the bodies?
What is going on, Kurdoglu? The Kayi Beys.

text: Zaman ah etme vah etme zamanı değildir.
english: Time is not the time to waste.

text: Obamızın düreği Süleyman Şah'ımız ve Koç yiğitlerimizden hâlâ haber gelmedi.
english: The tribe's leader Suleyman Shah and our Kocids have not been informed yet.

text: Allah muhafaza bizim her türlü ihtimale hazırlıklı olmamız gerek.
english: God protect us. We must be ready for any situation.
The unity and unity of our tribe is in danger.

text: Bir de tüm bu belaların ortasında Halep işi.
english: And Halep is in the middle of all this.

text: Beyimizin dillik zamanında vardığı bu kararı...
english: I do not want to hear this decision...

text: Zorluk zamanında tekrar gözden geçirmemiz gerekir.
english: We must review it again when it's difficult.

text: Ya ne edeceğiz Kurdoğlu? Kafandan geçen nedir? Kafamdakini demeden önce......şunu hatırlatmak isterim ki...
english: What are we going to do, Kurdoglu? What is on your mind? Before I say what is on my mind, I want to remind you that...

text: Süleyman Şahımız yola koyulmadan önce vekaleti bana bırakmıştır.
english: ...Suleyman Shah left the branch to me before he set out.
My word...
It's our Bey's word.
Eyvallah.

text: Alep'in akıbeti meçhul yollarına revan olmaya gönlüm razı değildir.
english: I do not want to be a slave to the unknown paths of Aleppo.
...for the sake of the tribe.
The court will judge.
He will give the verdict.
Let's tie this man to the box.

text: Çok şükür sağ salim döndünüz. Allah dualarımı kabul etti.
english: Thank God, you are back safe and sound. God has accepted my prayers.
We will.
How will I erase it?

text: Yeryüzünde külünüz bile kalmayacak! Dedenin ergelesine bak hâlâ ağlıyor! Dur! Ne yapıyorsun? Duymadın mı beyin sözünü? Kayıya bey sözü çiğnemek yaraşır mı?
english: I won't even have a day off on earth! Look at the old man's head, he's still crying! Stop! What are you doing? Didn't you hear the mayor's word? Wouldn't it be appropriate to say the mayor's word to the Kayi?

text: ...bucağı seslenin ve bir bakıversin sana ha?
english: I want you to look after your husband.
Don't worry, Ayme.
I'm just tired.
Where are the Bey's signs?
That is what he does.
Don't show your face, Hayme.
Let's cool off a bit.
We'll talk about it later.

text: ...gırtlağına sapladı. Keşke anlattıklarını ben de görebilseydim.
english: ...in the middle of the night. I wish I could see what they are talking about.
You know?

text: Ben de büyüyünce Ertuğrul abim gibi olacağım. Onun kadar güçlü ve onun kadar cesur olacağım.
english: I will be like my brother when I grow up. I will be as strong and brave as he is.
See?

text: Böyle giderse bütün Alp'leri geçeceksin Dündar. Ağabey.
english: If you go like this, you'll pass all the Alps, Dündar. Brother!

text: Yiğit de bana düşmanla nasıl cenk ettiğini anlatıyordu. O da çok cesurdu ama. Onları da anlattı mı?
english: Yigit was telling me how he fought the enemy. He was very brave too. Did he tell them?
I'll go and check on my father.
Tell me.
Did you do the job I assigned you?

text: Sen gittikten sonra oba halkına bir şeyler oldu.
english: Something happened to the people of the tribe after you left.

text: Halim ablanın çadırını taşladılar. Çadırımı taşladılar? Evet. Halim abla da içerideydi. İçeride mi? Allah'a şükür anam geldi de hepsinin ağzının payını verdi.
english: They've raided Halime's tent. They raided my tent? Yes. Halime was inside. Inside? Thank God, my mother came and gave her all.

text: Sonra Halime ablaya gidip bizim otağa geçtiler.
english: Then they went to Halime and came to our tent.
I know you have a problem.
I know you fell for it.
But this is temporary.

text: Sen bu güçlüklerin üstesinden de gelmeyi bilirsin.
english: You know how to overcome these difficulties.
I just didn't fall for it.
I put it to the test.

text: Benimle yola çıkan alplerimin öldüğüne mi yanayım?
english: Am I to blame for the death of my Alps?

text: O Kara Toygar köpeğinin eline esir düştüğüme mi?
english: That black toygar, the one who got captured by the dog?
Our Bey's.
My own father.

text: Beni kurtarmak için teslim olması mı beni yerin dibine soksun?
english: ...to save me, to put me down...

text: Yoksa Ertuğrul'un gelip kahramanlık yapması mı?
english: Or is it Ertugrul's heroism?

text: Tohumu onlar ekti, Kara Toygar seni biçti. Değirmen taşını da öğütürdün diye şimdi de kendini mi suçlayacaksın? Asıl suçlular keyif çatmakta.
english: They planted the seed and Kara Toygar grew you. Now you will blame yourself for being raised on the stone of the mill. The real culprits are enjoying themselves.
Welcome, Ertugrul Bey.
I was going to come to see you.

text: Ağabey, ana maş yapmıştır. Ben bir gidip bakayım.
english: Brother, the mother has played. I'll go and see.

text: Yüreğim yine haklı çıktı. Sen bir defa daha verdiğin sözü tuttun.
english: My heart is in my heart again. You kept your promise once again.

text: Babamla kardeşimi sağ salim bana getirdin.
english: You brought my father and brother to me.

text: Allah senden razı olsun Ertugrul Bey.
english: May God bless you, Ertugrul Bey.

text: Çok şükür, sağ salim gidip dönmek nasip oldu.
english: Thank God, I am lucky enough to go back safely.

text: ...gitmemizi fırsat bilenlerin yaptıklarını duydum Halime Sultan.
english: I heard what the people who know the opportunity did, Halime Sultan.
I heard.
They don't know themselves, they have done shameful things.

text: Beylerine, törelerine ihanet edip cadır taşlamışlar.
english: They betrayed their Beys and their tribes and set up a tent.

text: Sizler yoktunuz elbet ama Beyin Hatun'un tüm yiğitlerin anası Hayman'la dağ gibi yerindeydi.
english: You weren't there but the Bey's wife was in a place like a mountain where all the brave men were.
I was also scared.
They will be under what they did.
You left and came back.

text: Bu bana yeter. Şükretmekten ne dilimde ne yüreğimde öfkeye yer kalmadı.
english: This is enough for me. I have no more words or feelings to thank you.
...who were jealous of you before they died.
They were in pain.
They lost their loved ones because of us.
You are so pure-hearted.

text: Sana yapılan kötülükler bile onu kirletemiyor.
english: Even the evil that is done to you cannot tarnish it.

text: Bize biçilen ömürde kötüler kadar iyiler de vardır.
english: There are as many good things as bad things in life.

text: Şükürler olsun ki derdini veren Allah dermanını da veriyor.
english: Thank God, God heals the one who causes trouble.
My father told me.

text: Biz Selçuk topraklarından çıkana kadar bizim yanımızda olacakmışsınız.
english: Will you be with us until we leave the Seljuk lands?
If God permits.
Acun will be waiting there.
If you'll excuse me.

text: Seni çok güzel bir kızla tanıştıracağım.
english: I will introduce you to a beautiful girl.
Gundogdu Bey.

text: Olanacak biri varsa o sen değilsin.
english: If there is anyone who will be ashamed of me, it is not you.
...who has caused all this trouble for us.

text: Üçtüğüm şu hallere bir bak hatun.
english: Look at the state I am in, wife.

text: Ahalinin gözünde düştüğüm şu hallere bir bak.
english: Look at the state I'm in.
My honor is under your feet.

text: Kasalanma sen, ahali de bilir gerçeği.
english: Don't be ridiculous. The people know the truth.

text: Gel kayayı oynatmaz, tozunu alır. Vazgeçmek sana yakışmaz. Şimdi sofraya gel.
english: Come on, it is not fun to play with the rock. It takes away your dust. It is not suitable for you to give up. Now come to the table.
Your father is waiting for everyone at the table.
I'm sorry.
What will happen now?
Kara Toygar, if we talk...

text: Ne gerekiyorsa o yapılacak. Ok bir kere çıktı yaydan.
english: He will do whatever he needs. The arrow has been shot once.

text: Kimin nasibiyse ona satlanacak. Beyim Kara Toygar'ı halletsek bile Süleyman Şah yokken ortalığı biz ateşlendirdik.
english: Whoever has the chance will be killed. My Bey, even if we kill Kara Toygar......we set the whole place on fire when Suleyman Shah was not around.

text: Demez mi bu işin ardında kim var diye? Bu işi bir sorguladı mı...
english: Didn't he say who was behind this? Did he question this?

text: İlk benim kellem gider! Bay Bora!
english: ...I will be the first to lose. Mr Bora.
Now is the time for the storm.

text: Kuru yaprak gibi titreşip durursan savrulursun.
english: You will be shaken like a dry leaf.
Stand up a little.
What can I do Mr Biggi?
He will disappear for a while.
I will let you know when I find out.
Thank you.
What are we going to do, my Bey?
Do you have a plan?

text: Süleyman Şah'ımızın yokluğunda sahip çıktığımız emanetlerini...
english: ...the relics we have in the absence of Suleyman Shah...
...will return to our Suleyman Shah.
Where is your brother? He is talking to Halime.
Sorry, I made you wait.

text: Gökçe hadi kızım sen de otur.
english: Gokce, come on, sit down.
Bismillahirrahmanirrahim.
We delayed it a bit.

text: Bana verdiğin Berat'ı aleve götürmem lazım baba.
english: I need to take the money you gave me to Berat Alev, father.
The guests want to go too.
I do not know where they will go.

text: Ama en azından Halep'e kadar beraber yol alalım diye konuştuk.
english: But we agreed to go together to Aleppo.
If you allow me.
Especially when it's a meeting.
We'll see when the funeral comes
We brought them to where they belong.

text: Ne oluyor Rahman? Kurdoğlu, belli kalametlerini getirmiş. Sizle görüşmek için huzura kabulünü bekler Bey'im.
english: What is happening, Ahman? Kurdoglu has brought the Beylik's signs. He is waiting for your approval to meet you, my Bey.
Is it?
Wait.
Who said?
The cell where Hamza is hiding.
Who is behind this?

text: Demem beyim, dersen beni sağ koymazlar. Sağ koymazlar demek.
english: I can't, sir. They won't let me live. They won't let you live?

text: Demezsen bizim seni sağ bırakacağımızı kim söyledi?
english: Who said we would let you go?

text: Ölüyor lan köpek. Halime bacının çadırına attığın taşlar da bu kadar büyük müydü ha?
english: What are you saying, dog? Were the stones that you threw at uncle Halime's tent this big?
I wish you a happy life.
Who set fire and burned the environment?
Who? Speak!
Get out!

text: ...pehlivan endamlı yiğitlere böyle ufak tefek taşlar yanaşmaz.
english: ...the brave men of the Pehlivan dynasty are not fit for such a small group.

text: Öyle dağ yavrusu gibi olanları ancak eser.
english: He only kills those who are more like a baby.
He made me do it.
He made you a barber.
I'm not going.
My brother's madness...
My father's stubbornness...
...the enemy's cruelty is not enough...

text: Bir de içimizde bir hain türedi.
english: And we have a traitor in us.

text: kendi insanını düşmana satan bir hain.
english: A traitor who sold his own people to his enemy.
Who is this traitor? I don't know.

text: Ah bir bilsem kendi elimle vereceğim cezasını.
english: If I knew, I'd punish him myself.
But it is obvious that we are very close.

text: Demek düşmana haber verecek kadar yakın bir hain var. Ama sen hâlâ çadırına çekilip......derdine yanacak kadar sessiz ıssız kalırsın öyle mi?
english: So, you have a traitor close enough to inform the enemy. But you are still silent and silent enough to be drawn into your tent and your problems will be burned, right?
Don't you understand?

text: Bu obanın umudu sensin Gündoğdu. Meydanı boş bırakma. Kim olduğu belirsiz o insanlar yüzünden obanın dirliğinin bozulmasına müsaade etme.
english: You are the hope of this tribe, Gundogdu. Don't leave the square empty. Don't let the tribe's reputation be ruined because of those people.

text: Kim olduğu belirsiz o insanlar dediklerin var ya...
english: You know those people you call uncertain?
...the Seljuk dynasty, Hatun.

text: Numan denilen o herif şehzade, o hakir gördüğün kız da sultan.
english: The man called Numan is the Shahzada... and the girl you see is the Sultan.

text: Başımıza bunları neden geldiği şimdi belli oldu. Ertuğrul'un obaya musallat ettiği dert kendi boyunu da aştı.
english: Now it is clear why we are facing this. The trouble that Ertugrul caused to the tribe has become worse.

text: Sen burada oturup olanları mı seyredeceksin......yoksa ayağa kalkıp gücünü mü göstereceksin? Ya hatun anlamaz mısın?
english: Are you going to sit here and watch what is happening... or stand up and show your strength? Don't you understand, Hatun?
He is the one who protects the Shahzada and his family.

text: Beni kurtaran o, babamı kurtaran o! Kara Toygar'ı esir alan da o!
english: He saved me, he saved my father. He took Kara Toygar prisoner.
But... No buts!
I'm tired.

text: Böyle bir Arturul Beylerle Selçuklu mülkiyetinden emniyetli bir şekilde çıkalım. Ondan sonrası benim vazifem şehzadem. Gönlünüzü ferah tutun.
english: Let us leave the Seljuk Empire with the Arturul Beys. Then it is my duty, Shahzada. Be at ease.

text: Zor zamanlarımızda çok yardımcı oldun Afim Bey.
english: You have been very helpful in our difficult times, Afsin Bey.

text: Sağ olasın. Estağfurullah Şehzadem, görevlisin. Baba.
english: Thank you. You are welcome, my Shahzada. You are our duty. Father?
Son.
I'm tired of running away, dad.
We're always on the road. We always run away.
I'm scared when I run, dad.

text: Burada ilk defa bir arkadaşım oldu. İlk defa oyun oynadım.
english: I have a friend here for the first time. I played a game for the first time.

text: Ne olur gitmeyelim baba, burada kalalım.
english: Please, dad. Let's stay here.
But we have to go, son.
For your sister.
You.
What are you doing?

text: ...ik defa Alp'lik sıfatını hak edebilmek için gönderildiğim dağlarda gördüm.
english: I saw Isra in the mountains where I was sent to......to acquire the Alp's attribute for the first time.
He was different from all the other Kisraks.
Your Highness.
We are all in your shoes.
It was hard to catch him.
It's a problem to bring her here.
He would always go to the one who is in charge.
Then drink the water of the father.
You ate the bread.
He is married.
As you believe.

text: Güvenlikçe benim için ne kadar kıymetli olduğunu anladı.
english: He realized how precious my work is as he became more and more secure.
That's yours now.
If you'll excuse me.
I named him Sultan.
If God permits.
You will not be separated from me.
We have a long road to go together.

text: Bunu belli olsa da yol hala bizim.
english: Even if that is clear, the path is still ours.
Thank you, Ertugrul Bey.
I will look at the Sultan like my own eyes.
He will live with me as long as I live.
I am sorry, my Bey.
We found out who brought the people to the castle.
Who?
Mr. Bora.
You didn't get bored of that Kurdoglu.
You don't like to wait.
What kind of a word is that, my Bey?
We will wait for you for life if necessary.

text: Gelmiş geçmiş olsun beyim. Allah seni bize bağışladı.
english: May God forgive you, my Bey. May God forgive you.
What happened is in the past.
You tell me.
What happened in the tribe when I was not there?
It was Hamza who saw it, sir.
They're busy.
Then we'll give the whole place to Velvele.
I swear...
Hayme Ana will be revealed...
He knows the limits of those cowards.
He said that he knew the limits of the inviolable.
What did you do, Kurdoglu?

text: Önce beyleri otağda toplayıp yatıştırdım deyin.
english: I gathered the Beys in the tent and put them to sleep.

text: Otağı boş gördüler. Obayı sahipsiz sanmasınlar istedim.
english: They saw the tent as empty. I didn't want them to think that the tribe was empty.
Otherwise things would have been out of control.
...and do your duty...
...we've managed to get everything under control.
Well...

text: Ya beylik alametlerini taşımak da neyin nesidir Kurdoğlu?
english: What is it like to carry the Beydom's emblems, Kurdoglu?

text: Hayme Hatun burada kendi derdiyle uğraşırken...
english: While Hayme Hatun was dealing with her own problems...

text: Bir de oba işleriyle onu bunaltmak uygun düşmez dedim.
english: I said that I would not let him be depressed by the tribe business.
Thank you.

text: Ama obada bir hain var belli.
english: But there is a traitor in the tribe.
I told you, my Bey.
...who saw Hamza from the people.

text: Akçakoca, Hamza'nın yarasını tımar için çadıra gidip çıkarken fark etmişlerdir.
english: Akcakoca must have noticed Hamza's wound when he was going to the tent.
Not two, Kurdoglu.

text: Obayı bastıklarında biri onlara yol göstermiş.
english: When they hit the road, someone showed them the way.
Same person.

text: Takas yapılacak yeri de Kara Toygar'a haber etmiş. Oyunu Ertuğrullar bozmasaydı...
english: He informed Kara Toygar about the place for the auction. If Ertugrul's men hadn't ruined the game...

text: Telef olup gittik içtik dağ başlarında.
english: We were drunk and went to the mountains.
If there is someone like that...

text: Obanın ortasında kendi ellerimle derisini yüzerim.
english: I will skin him alive in the middle of the tribe.

text: Bana başka bir emrin var mı beyim?
english: Do you have any other orders?
We will gather the Beys and discuss the dispute.
My intention...

text: Kara Toygar'ı yargılaması için sultana göndermek.
english: ...to send him to the Sultan for the trial of Kara Toygar.

text: Sen de bana toyda destek ol, arka çık. Ahaliyi teskin etmek gerek. Yine en doğru kararı vermişsin beyim.
english: You should support me in the headquarters. You should calm the people. You have made the right decision again, my Bey.
Don't you worry.
We had a hard time.

text: Vesveseyi bırakmalısın. Kurdoğlu gereğini yapmış. Üstünde durma.
english: You must stop talking nonsense. Kurdoglu did what he had to. Do not be upset.
You are the right one, my Bey.
Thank you.

text: Zaten ateş çemberindeyiz. Bir gören olursa ne düşünür?
english: We are already in the fire. What would anyone think?

text: Ters ters konuşma Kurdoğlu. Artık suç ortağıyız. Ya beraber çıkacağız, ya beraber batacağız.
english: Don't talk back, Kurdoglu. We are partners now. We will either go out together or we will die together.

text: Söyleyeceklerimi duyduğunda buraya hemen geldiğim için şükredeceksin.
english: When you hear what I have to say, you will thank me for coming here.

text: Şu bizim obaya sığınan göçmen kuşlar aslında kimmiş bilir misin?
english: Do you know who these migratory birds are that are taking refuge in our tribe?

text: Tamam Kurdoğlu Bey'im. Gündoğdu'ya geleceğinizi söylerim. Çok sevinecektir.
english: Okay, Kurdoglu Bey. I will tell Gundogdu that you will come. He will be very happy.
Good luck, Ertugrul.

text: Yıldırım gibi çadırıma düşmenin sebebi nedir?
english: What is the reason for falling into the tent like lightning?
Do you know where Mr. Bora is?

text: Nereden bileyim Ertugrul? Ama lazımsa buldurayım. Sen zahmet etme.
english: How should I know, Ertugrul? But I can find him if I need to. Do not bother.
I will find him.
Good luck.
to go to Ertugrul's with you.
I saw it with my own eyes, sister.

text: O kıza bir at hediye etti. Yeter!
english: He gave a horse to that girl. Enough!
I'm in trouble again.
You just sit and cry, Gokce.
Ertugrul is up to something.
Take care of Baybora.
We must break the chain without getting caught.
Do I have permission to come in, father?
Come, my girl.
How are you, father?

text: Bir şeye ihtiyaç var mıdır? Sağ ol gelin kız.
english: Do you need anything? Thank you, bride.
How are you?
How is Gundogdu?
I am sorry, father.
I am afraid that he will not recover.
He suffered a lot.

text: Ama en çok alplerin ölmesi yaraladı onu.
english: But he was most affected by the Alps' death.
He told me about going to Aleppo.
He found a new home.

text: Ama haberi alınca sevinmeye bile hâl olmadı.
english: But when I heard about it, I didn't even feel happy.

text: Yemekte Ertuğrul, Halep'e gideceğim deyince de iyice dertlenir oldu.
english: When Ertugrul said he would go to Aleppo, he was worried.
If Gundogdu had gone to Aleppo...
Maybe he could recover a little.
I didn't know either.

text: Ne yapacağımı bilemeden bekler durur mu?
english: He waits for me to do something.
...and then Gundogdu.
